titles.title: A bill to prohibit further launches of the space shuttle until improved safety features have been developed and installed.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on Science, Space, and Technology.
Referred to Subcommittee on Space Science Applications.

bill.summary: 2/3/1987--Introduced. Prohibits launching any space shuttle orbiter unless it is equipped with an escape mechanism which assures that the astronauts aboard will have a realistic chance of survival and recovery should problems arise during the flight as a result of equipment malfunction or hardware defects. Directs the National Aeronautics and Space Administration to: (1) proceed expeditiously with the development and testing of an escape mechanism to achieve such purpose; and (2) periodically report to the appropriate congressional committees on the progress being made.
